page.title: 01SUMMARY
page.content: Our area is mainly flat but round at the edges it gets hilly. The main feature is an old abandoned airfield in the middle. The area is mainly farmland consisting of crops and rough grazing land. Most of the agricultural area is owned by Rockingham Estates. Towards the north-west there are two villages, Stoke Albany and Wilbarston. In the south-east is the village of Pipewell. There are several farms dotted around called Wood Farm, Woodlands Farm, White Lodge Farm, Home Farm, Dob Hall Farm, and Park Farm. The woods in the area are Bowd Lane Wood, Walter Wood, Pipewell Woods, part of Stoke Wood, and Askershaw Woods. There is a by-pass running past Stoke Albany and Wilbarston. This is to stop big lorries coming through the villages. Near the by-pass is Dallacre Farm Estate. There are few roads in our area
